title: Kinetic friction - block sliding up incline

content.question: A block is given an initial velocity up an incline that makes an angle of <math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>53</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> from the horizontal. As it is sliding up the incline, the block is slowing down with a constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. If the coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the incline is <math alttext="0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn></math>, what is <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="8 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>8</mn><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="11 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>11</mn><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="13 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>13</mn><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="11 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>11</mn><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
